presentation.title: O Sacred Head, Now Wounded
presentation.author: Bernard of Clairvaux
Hanns Hassler
presentation.slide: O sacred Head, now wounded, with grief and shame weighed down, Now scornfully surrounded with thorns, Thine only crown; How art Thou pale with anguish, with sore abuse and scorn! How does that visage languish, which once was bright as morn!

What language shall I borrow to thank Thee, dearest friend, For this Thy dying sorrow, Thy pity without end? O make me Thine forever, and should I fainting be, Lord, let me never, never outlive my love to Thee.
